intro: Cassia cordistipula, commonly known as the African sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. Cassia cordistipula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
